inn1.comm: swung but down the leg side. Gentle loosener ... 72mph
again legish but a big noise as it passed Vincent. Loud appeal but the umpire gives a wide to everyone's bemusement. It certainly clipped the pad
swung back into Vincent's pads, loud appeal but too high and a  sniff of an edge
punched down the ground, well timed and it just kept on going
again swinging down the leg, hits the pads and a muted appeal
Vaas getting some good inswing but at a very gentle pace
safely blocked into the off side
Vaas struggling to control the inswing and again that's down the leg side. The third wide of the over
jabbed back and Vincent quick to spot mid off loitering and he scurries through for the single even thought the ball barely made it past the stumps
outside off stump and kept going away from the right hander
wide again, and this time called by the umpire. Vincent flashed but missed and the ball kept lifting through to the keeper
again short outside off stump and Vincent slashes and misses
left alone but it keep its line and much closer to the stumps
another wide - that's five in the first two overs - and Malinga's action means that if he gets it wrong then it will keep moving away from the right-hander
slight overcompensation and Vincent turns it down to fine leg
at last!  Good line and beats Vincent outside the off stump
moved and bounced away from Fleming as he sparred
short, blocked off the back foot
punched off the back foot to wide mid on
another no ball. Vaas has given away five extras so far. He's struggling for line, length and step
and another one. He remeasures his run up
again Fleming can do no more than defend it
left alone outside off stump ... Vaas seems to have found a degree of rhythm
the nine-ball over finishes with a ball on off stump which Fleming blocks
straight, bouncy and blocked
Vincent onto the front foot for the first time to Malinga and pushed to point
wide enough to leave
good line, defended with extreme watchfulness
on middle stump, flicked to mid on
plopped to mid off to end a maiden. Malinga has a slight problem in that when he bowls it outside off stump it swings away, when it's straight it doesn't move a jot
and fret he might as it arcs wide and gets wider
beats Fleming's attempted flick, Vaas appeals but going down the leg
straight, slightly short and perhaps keeps a tad low, traps Fleming on the back foot and not a doubt that was going on to hit the middle stump three-quarters of the way up. Fleming almost walked!
left alone
pushed to extra cover
drifting down the leg, clips the pads and runs very fine. Malinga scurries round from long leg and intercepts it inches short of the rope
again swinging down the leg side, Astle shapes to flick it through midwicket but misses and it hits him on the pads
whoa! That spat and Sangakkara takes it high above his head but it is wide of off stump in the first place
neatly glanced to fine leg
on off stump, the fastest ball of the day at 89.3mph (143kph)
straight and quick enough to make Astle leap to keep it out
Malinga generating pace but struggling for a consistent line ... this one is too leg side
pushed wide of point but athletically stopped by a diving Kapugedera
good shout, but Vincent took a big stride and that raised enough doubt in the umpire's mind
slow and straight
swinging down the leg side but Vincent misses an intended flick
pushed to extra cover. Malinga is averaging 86-87 mph, Vaas about 75
Wide and Koertzen lets him off the hook  ... either that or his arms are getting tired
good end to a maiden over, on off stump
Malinga once again forces Astle to hurry. His pace and a bit of bounce is leaving Astle looking unsettled
unconvincing back-foot block
plopped into the covers
Astle is staying on the back foot ... this time he steers the ball the point
Malinga strays onto leg stump and overpicthes, and a relieved Astle clips that just behind square for four
on the spot and played with ease
Vincent misses an attempted leg-side flick for the umpteenth time ... it's almost as if Vaas is too slow for him to be able to time the ball
off stump and blocked
slightly shorter and Vincent opens up and looks to clout it through point ... but misses
leg side, Vincent waits and turns rather than hits it to deepish square leg
no ball No. 4 from Vaas, Astle has a heave and misses
on middle-and-leg, Astle mistimes a flick straight to midwicket
on leg stump, easily turned to the man two-thirds back at square leg
pp in the slot, mistimed drive bobbles to mid on
very wide, Sangakkara throws himself to his right to gather the ball
short, spears back into Astle who can do nothing other than let the ball hit him
Another mistimed shot from Vincent, this time a pull which trickles to mid on
shot of the day (so far). Outside off stump and overpitched, it is clouted over the infield to the extra-cover fence
played back to the bowler who picks it up and flicks it at the striker's stumps, and Vincent has to throw himself back into his ground although the ball misses the stumps by an inch
punched to cover
defended off the back foot into the leg-side
thoughts of a single as that one's dropped down to mid-off, but there's a loud call of "No"
slower ball driven firmly to the covers
timed with a straight drive down the ground
hit out to the covers
pushed on to the back foot again and that's teased into the circle on the off-side
pitches on off and moves into the batsman off the seam where it's defended on the back foot
sleek fielding from Maharoof as the batsman pushes the ball back to him and sets off looking for a run but it's gathered in the left hand and winged low to the keeper
full and hittable but the batsman fails to time that one properly and the bowler gets away with it
the batsman is onto it this time and whacks that behind square where it's gathered by the fielder
attempted front-foot drive through mid-wicket is picked up
half-steered, half-edged down to the man at deep third man
a horrible shot from Vincent, trying to push things on. He didn't pick the ball up at all and heaved across the line; the ball kept low and cleaned him up a treat
defended into the covers
defended on the back foot this time as that ball left him no room
more defence and this time it's on the front foot
the tidy stuff continues from Vaas and this one is guided down off the back foot
a leg-side line this time and that's worked off the hips but finds the fielder at mid-wicket
good ball, squeezed up there but the batsman does well to eke out a run, nudging that one to mid-off. Good cricket
straight delivery and that's defended again
great delivery, and a frustrated Astle launches his shoulders into that one which is in the corridor but he completely misses as it curves away from his bat and on to the keeper
worked off his legs and through the gap between mid-on and mid-wicket, cracking shot
turned off his hips to mid-wicket this time
short of a length and that's driven through cover but it's chased to the boundary and stopped just inside the rope
decent delivery to end the over; straight and up there and it's defended
straight delivery again and the batsman can only defend that one into the covers
turned to the leg-side boundary and the batsmen run two
stroked into the covers, but that's not quite timed properly
dropped. A great attempt by Dilshan at gully, diving to his left, and he got two hands to the ball - but he certainly stopped the boundary
a few oohs and aahs as the ball pops out of Sangakkara's hands, but in fact the ball just beat the outside edge as it bent away from the righthander
jams his bat down on one which pitches up and just outside off
worked behind point
crashed to point this time
looks to steer that one off his hips into the mid-wicket region where it's picked up easily
speared right up there and that's tickled into the leg-side region
again that's up there but it's steered out to cover
the batsman does well to make room to work that well behind point; it's very well timed indeed and that races away
a huge edge and Marshall gets away with that one as it flies through the vacant second slip area
defended into the covers this time
gone! Not the best ball - short and wide but that's struck right at the man at backward point who snaps it up at chest height
left alone outside off stump
in a good area and the batsman can only defend
defended into the mid-wicket area
right on top of the delivery and that's a great shot from Astle, square on the off side
hit out to point
pitched on a good length and that's helped into cover
defended into gully
fired in at the pads and that raps him on the hip but there was no chance of an lbw shout, as it was sliding down leg
hit out to point and that's picked up
stands tall and looks to drive that on the up through mid-on but it's picked up by the fielder
defended this time
on the button and that's defended
more defence and this is some great bowling
right up there but straight and that's whipped into the mid-wicket region for a quick single
great delivery, right into the blockhole where it's dug out well
steered down to third man where it's winged back in
worked off his hips into short mid-wicket and that's quickly thrown to the non-striker's end but there's no danger of a run out
an attempted cover drive results in a thick edge down to third man
worked out to point
tried to get that through the gap but found the man at cover instead
fuller delivery and that's squeezed out to mid-off
full toss, driven to deepish mid on. Jayasuriya looked stiff when he bowled that one
wide, short, Styris slashed and got a thin but very audible edge and Sangakkara's banshee-like appeal echoed all round the empty stadium.
cautious defence
left alone, kept its line which was outside off stump

Oram moved across to play through the leg side, but he missed it and the ball looked to be hitting all three. Raucous appeals but not out the decision. That's an odd one, even without the benefit of replays. It might have been slipping over but that could be the only doubt
no room for anything there
on off stump, blocked. Brisk and accurate, adding to the pressure on the batsmen
and the same again, driven to extra cover
outside off stump, left alone and skids through
more of the same ...  the ball is starting to keep low
nurdled to mid on from off stump
Jaaysuriya has found his spot
... and hits it again
Oram tries to sweep from outside off stump, misses, but they get a scrambled run
blocked and accompanied, as is every ball, by yells from Sangakkara which suggest someone is sticking a safety pin into him
and squawk
clipped into the gap for an easy single to keep the strike
short and hammered behind square on the off.  Maharoof  holds his head in his hands
better line allowing no width
paddled to mid on
driven firmly to mid off, sharp single and although the shy at the stumps at the bowler's end hits, Astle was well in
leggish, strikes Oram on the pads
pushed to mid off again, and another quick single
no chance for anything there
paddled round to long leg
flicked to midwicket
attempted a slog-sweep but the ball was so slow that he missed it
worked into the space and a single to long on
again nice placement
full length, controlled sweep to backward square leg
Oram plays pushed forward-defensive shot
same again but this time Oram misses it
Oram steps to the off, the ball stays straight and shaves the leg stump, but is called a wide

Oram walks across his stumps again to counter the spin and looks rather silly as the ball stays straight and bowls him round his legs. The previous ball was a warning, but he  ignored it and paid. He actually missed that by about a foot and it hit middle.
with fielders crowded round the bat, McCullum pushed forward and the ball flies to silly point and screeching appeals implore the umpire to give the bat-pad catch. Nothing doing
a low-key end to a remarkable over
up in the groove and defended with ease
defended to mid off
pushed into the overs and an ambled single
McCullum watches that off the pitch before blocking
circumspect defence
another solid forward-defensive shot
well placed again
McCullum attempts a sweep but makes a real dog's dinner of it
this time he opts for a more conventional block
and once more watches carefully
more width and McCullum slashes at it but misses and Sangakkara spills the ball
the Doosra which McCullum pulls round to square leg
blocked off the back foot
Defensive shot but with soft hands to take the pace off the ball and the pair scurry through for a neat single to extra cover
loud appeal but sliding down the leg
turned to leg
played to the man at midwicket
and again unable to find the gap in the ring

Slog-sweep from well outside off stump, possibly off the bottom of the bat, and the ball arcs to Malinga who runs in about 10 yards from deep midwicket to take a routine catch.  Astle has rarely looked in form and with wickets tumbling at the other end, has not had the luxury of having the time to do so
flighted, McCullum waits and punches it into the covers
got in a muddle and the ball went nowhere
safely defended
cut from outside off stump, along the ground to deep backward point
again well played
defended on the front foot again and that one trickles in front of the covers
guided into the covers again, this time a little more forcefully
tickled gently into mid-wicket
hit firmly off the back foot and that goes to point
pitches wide outside off and that's easily left
pitched right up there and that's defended on the front foot
defended once more
that one strays down leg and that's worked out to mid-wicket
goes over the top and just to say clears the man at mid-on to get off the mark with a boundary - the first one for the Kiwis in eight overs
showing some more enterprise here, Vettori, with a quick single into the off side
plays with the spin and lifts one which pitches on off stump safely over to the leg side
pitches a touch short and that's taken off the legs and moved into mid-wicket
rushes that one past the outside edge and there's a cry of "Aaah" as Vettori tries to work that one to third man
done again by one which pitches outside off, stays straight and defeats the outside edge
doesn't get hold of a straight drive and the bowler picks it up easily
waits for that one and drives it to wide mid-on
worked to mid-wicket
defended into the leg side
a quick single, well taken into mid-wicket

what a terrible shot from McCullum, attempting a reverse sweep which crashes off the bat onto his pad and pops up to Jayawardene at slip. The Sri Lankans cry loudly but there's a short delay until the umpire finally nods his head. New Zealand's chances of batting out the full 50 overs are fast receding here
that's defended and it runs into the vacant gully, tempting the batsmen for a quick single but as the fielder scampers round from point they decide against it
a quiet defensive stroke this time
beats the outside edge and that runs through to the keeper
that pitches outside off and stays straight, with the batsman just dropping his bat down on it
the batsman drops on one knee and sweeps that out to the man on the mid-wicket boundary
that one pitches on off and the batsman tries to work it into the mid-wicket area
risky single, well fielded by Jayawardene but it flies low to Sangakkara
a huge shout for one which pitches outside off, keeps low and comes in a touch
defended this time
oh! How did that miss? Goes the other way from the doosra. looked to play the off break outside the off stump and that spins right back and misses leg, somehow. Murali raises his arms in the air
defended this time
straight and that's defended
defended forward once more
pitches outside off stump and that's worked into the gully region
tries to cut the doosra and that bounces down just in front of the first (and only) slip
tickled out behind square
hit to point
played that one off the back foot which he drives to mid-off
strayed down leg and that's hit off the pads behind square for a leg-bye
lovely shot! The batsman goes over the top for a sweet four over mid-wicket; the ball bounces once before the rope. That will bring some relief to New Zealand, albeit of the drop-in-the-ocean variety
defended this time
worked off the front foot and there's a frantic call for two. A fumble in the field allows them to get back fairly comfortably; good running in the end

a big scream and that's plumb, and Murali's fourth. The batsman took the smallest of steps forward to play that one on the front but he's trapped by the ball which pitches on off and would have gone on to hit middle-and-leg
a big shout but that's turned down this time
heaves his arms at that one and just about connects with one which he works down to fine leg
worked into mid-wicket
pitches on off and that's helped into the short mid-wicket region
straight, and that's worked off the hips square

horrible low delivery matched in its ugliness by the lack of footwork and lame swish at the ball and a thick and loud under-edge is snapped up by the keeper. Sangakkara lets out a screaming appeal behind the stumps - it's so obvious that Jayasuriya doesn't even shout - and the umpire takes his time to give it, probably surprised at being asked. The batsman, for his part, just walks off. There was no real doubt
leg-side wide
that straightened a bit but was outside the off-stump and he was playing a shot so the umpire isn't interested in that shout
defended this time
picked up outside off and worked into mid-wicket
pitches on off and that's defended forward
worked off his legs and that finds the fielder square on the leg side
ah, lovely and that's too good for the batsman; a lovely off-break which totally defeats Patel who plays the ball far, far too late
defended into the leg-side
cut down to the man at point who picks it cleanly and wings it back in
flung straight in at the batsman who can only defend; good bowling again
attempted yorker finds the outside edge and that runs down to third man
oooh, splendid delivery eludes the outside edge, right down the corridor and that's too good for a swishing Patel
ooh, a yorker cannons right in on the toes but that would have missed leg stump
oooh, all kinds of things going on here. This time Vettori fails to connect with one which rushes past his outside edge
defended this time
looped in in front of the toes and that's defended on the front foot
defended on the back foot
ooh, well left. That one pitches outside off, comes back a touch but not enough to trouble the batsman
the batsman jams down his bat on that one and sends it into the mid-wicket region
that's swept confidently out to the boundary and Patel retains the strike
there's a half-cry from the keeper for a noise which is the bat crashing into the pitch as he tries to cover drive. There's no footwork whatsoever and Patel misses the ball completely
another attempted hit with no footwork
speared in at the toes but that's well dug out, confidently, too
attempted bouncer and that flies right over the top
hit into the covers
speared right up there but that's well played and they pick up a quick two
that one flies past the outside edge and into Sangakkara's hands
defended
flicked away behind square
reaches out to sweep that one to the man just inside the boundary
speared right up there and that's defended on the front foot
tickled into the covers
worked out just in front of point and the batsmen scramble a single. This is pretty decent tailend resistance, but their total is still woefully low
rushed at that one and it just fails to shave the outside of off stump
flashes at one which is quick and swinging and completely misses it
edged away to the third man boundary
defended this time
slower ball and that's left alone, but it's wide
driven to cover
dropped into the vacant point area and there's some clever running
worked out to deepish mid-on and Vettori continues to bat sensibly
defended into the covers this time
driven without much power to mid-off
dropped into short mid-wicket
speared up there and that's defended
dug out and the batsman moves forward, looking for a run, but soon dives back into his crease as the bowler picks up the ball cleanly
lifts that one off the off-stump line over to mid-wicket
defended off the back foot
defended forward
tidy stuff to end the over and that's defended on the back foot
ooh, how did that one miss the stumps? Well, it did and Vettori survives another ball
comes forward to play that one off the toes and through to mid-wicket
chipped that one off the legs to square
late cut, very impressive stroke indeed and that runs fine for the first boundary in 11 overs
not quite so impressive, a swoosh at that one and the keeper collects
good thinking there from Vettori who comes forward to play that one through mid-wicket and they scamper some more vital runs
low and full and that's easily driven to the on-side&
gave himself room to drive that through extra-cover for four
a third successive four, brilliant cricket from Vettori - this time it's a cut through point
a straightish cut to mid-off, and it's a no-ball to boot. Sri Lanka are just losing their shape a bit while Vettori assumes control
waited for it, a good shot off his toes, flicked down to fine leg for a gentle single
overstepped once more and this is sloppy from Vaas
speared up there and that's well defended down
cut down to fine leg
chipped to point, a soft dismissal in the end, but Patel did a decent job with Vettori and their team-mates will thank them for it.

inn2.comm: down the leg side, batsman flicks and misses and McCullum, the wicketkeeper (as if you didn't know) dives to his right and takes a fine save. Still a wide, though
better line and a bit of swing for Mills, inside edge as the lefthander tries to hit this through the covers
swinging and straightening onto the left hander who is rapped on the pads, Mills races down the pitch to roar his appeal...but it's just missing leg
left alone outside the off stump
firmly timed through the covers - a lovely check-driven cover drive by Tharanga, on the up
more swing into the left hander inducing an inside edge and they scamper a single
ooh in the air, he wasn't on top of that one at all - it almost stopped on him - but he pushed at it hard enough, guiding it past point for four
and he too starts with a wide down the leg side
a roar from Bond who digs this one in short outside the off stump, but he's overstepped
better length but too wide, the batsman flaying his hands at it and missing the ball by a country mile. Poor start to the over
another grunt from Bond who digs it in short and the batsman sways out of the way - just keeping his bat inside the line. Good bounce for Bond there
an absolute corker, pitched up and swinging away from Tharanga whose concrete feet and airy, wishy-washy stroke nearly had him walking back to the pavilion. Passes through to the wicketkeeper
quicker ball, fuller too, and it's left alone
blimey that was nearly a beamer. A full toss, chest height and rightly no-balled
pushes at this outside off and edges it wide of second slip, my word that was close. Races down to the third man boundary
and he tries to hammer this into the Indian ocean, missing it comfortably and shaking his head at his own misfortune.
goes back and tries to cut this, but can only hammer it into the ground getting a bottom edge and through to the wicketkeeper
good ball on middle stump, just a hint of swing into the left hander's pads and it's defended solidly
clipped off his pads wide of fine leg who runs round 15 yards or so to his right
nothing more than a gentle push but it fairly speeds through the infield and needs a good, diving stop from extra cover to prevent four. As it was, the dive prevented any runs
timed back to the bowler who does well to stop it
short, quick and evaded by the batsman who ducks underneath
a touch fuller inducing the drive but the batsman stays back in his crease and pushes it through the covers, albeit without much timing

ooh where's this gone, it's sailing over extra cover, is there anyone out there? Is there toffee! It's gone for six, what a ridiculously good shot that is. He just hit through the line, opened the face of the bat just a touch and it sails into the empty stands over extra cover
great comeback - quicker ball, outside off and the batsman fishes at it ungainly
"catch!" is the cry as Bond digs this in short but Jayasuriya hammers it over point. Clever, intelligent batting
fuller and swinging into his pads, timed perfectly to mid-off
a loud grunt from Bond who pitches it up, hitting the pads but they scamper a leg-bye
gorgeous straight drive but straight to long-off
hammered square but it was too short, and it bobbles into the covers
full and straight, defended solidly but it's dropped into the gap and they scamper a single
excellent delivery on middle-and-off, full and at a sharp pace too causing a rare defensive stroke
smacked off the back foot but straight to short extra cover
another clever shot, waiting for the ball and opening the face to late-cut it to third man
carved - there is no other word for it - over the infield for four. Typically Sri Lankan and perfectly executed; fine shot
down the leg side and it's another wide.

better delivery outside his off stump - fuller, too - and he gets an inside edge while trying to cut it. Very close to being bowled there. Races down for four more and Bond, Shane Bond, is utterly seething
another inside edge into his thigh
crisply driven back to the bowler who fields it on the half-volley

oh that's a cracker, and it's out! Swinging into Jayasuriya who pushes forward unconvincingly and it's taken by the wicketkeeper. He trudges off, clearly not content with the decision...and replays do suggest he's perhaps a bit unlucky there
fuller and swinging into the new right-handed batsman who nudges it to midwicket and they scamper a single
timed, beautifully, off the back foot but there's a fine stop in the covers
whipped off his pads but straight to square leg
shot! Hitting through the line without a care in the world, lofting it wide of long-off for a crashing boundary. No risk whatsoever and perfectly timed
pushed off his pads to deep midwicket and, blimey, how well has he timed this? It's racing away for four. He looks in decent touch
solidly defended on the front foot - a real "clunk" of the bat there
short and rising onto Jayawardene who goes back onto his stumps and defends off the back foot with the most straight of bats. Classical technique
shorter still but Jayawardene evades it with ease, just swaying his head out of the way. Too short from Bond - needlessly so
shot - fine, fine shot. Timed with supreme elegance through the covers, bisecting the fielders. A creamer.
better ball, fuller and straighter

outside off, Jayawardene tries to hit this back over the bowler's head but he gets a leading edge...the ball flies down to Nathan Astle at third man who can't quite get there in time, and the captain survives. Difficult chance - and the ball dropped like a stone
down the leg side - oh come on, this is rubbish
that's more like it. Outside the off stump, swinging back into the right-hander before cutting away (or straightening, rather) and Jayawardene plays and misses. Super ball.
left alone outside off...could almost have been another wide there
again swinging into the batsman who reads the line very well, coming confidently forward and presenting the full face of the bat. Solidly defended
shoulders arms outside the off stump
down the leg side and flicked off his pads - Mills is lucky, here, as Fleming still has his fine-leg on the boundary who saves four
defended reasonably solidly off the back foot
good start for Oram, on off stump and it jumps up at Jayawardene who adjusts his stroke to one which cuts back
no no no, too short and Jayawardene hammers it in front of square with immense power. No stopping that! He absolutely laced it
better length but Jayawardene is too canny, too wise and he leaves it well alone
stays back in his crease and defends it on the front foot
without moving his feet, pushing his hands at the ball, he defends this out into the covers
shoulders arms to one which moves back into the right-hander
cut but picked up well.
that pitched on off and moved away and it was cut intentionally wide of the man at slip, running down for four
on the button this time and that's defended
dug out again
defended this time
not much spin on this one which pitches outside off and is left alone, easily
the batsman makes room for himself to cut that one through point evading the fielder
that one goes across the lefthander, in the channel, but he shoulders arms and it whistles through to the keeper
straighter and that's just jabbed down into short mid-wicket. A direct hit would have had Tharanga way out
steady delivery, just dropped on a good length and the batsman can only defend that one
defended off the back foot
defended on the front foot this time
squared up by one which flies straight and true and the batsman can only defend, hopping, on the back foot
that one didn't turn very much, pitching outside off to the lefthander but it just goes on
defended into the covers this time
that ball didn't turn that time, pitched outside and that's defended but elicits a large shout anyway
dropped down to third man with a dab
stroked softly into the covers
defended off the back foot
shortish delivery, a little bit of bounce and that's defended off the back foot, with one hand coming off the bat
drops a touch wide of off and that's guided back behind square
dropped into mid-wicket for an easy single
driven forward and the batsman comes out of his crease. Oram picks up the ball and wings it back to McCullum, underarm, but the batsman was in his ground and the shy was wide anyway
played right over that one with a swish
tickled into the covers this time
looped in and that's driven softly to mid-off
pitches well outside off and it goes on straight
swept to the square boundary
a bit of air on that one and that's driven strongly through the covers, lovely shot
defended this time
pitches outside off and that comes in at the batsman who's on his toes, defending
again that one pitches outside off the batsman can only defend
that's cut, low off a straight bat, down to the man in at gully
a bouncer which gets up shoulder high and that's hooked round to the man behind square
defended down
glorious drive, just opening the face to get the ball past mid-off
in the air and safe, that cut teasing Marshall at backward point but well wide of him
hit behind point
cut off the back foot to the man out sweeping
gets over the ball and tickles it to square
defended on the back foot
comes forward to defend this time
that one held up a bit and that's worked square on the off side
bent in and the batsman gets a tiny leading edge on it and nods his head at a job well done by the bowler
on the button again and the batsman can only defend once more
on the front foot and that's defended
defended again, this is good bowling indeed
that's nudged down into the short mid-wicket region and that brings up the hundred
on the button and that's defended into the leg side without alarm
driven casually to the leg side
the ball stopped on the surface and that was played deliberately in the air to mid-on
driven out to long off this time
defended this time
worked off his hips square and that's good running
an easy single this time
an inside edge pops to the vacant short leg area
goes down on one knee to meet that one which pitches outside off and is swept confidently behind square
on the button this time and that's defended on the front foot
good cricket: good flight from the bowler, feet from the batsman (driving through mid-on off the front foot) and hands from the fielder, who scooped it easily
defended this time
that's worked off the legs behind square
extra loop and that's driven easily to long off
pushed up there and that's defended on the front foot
inside-out shot rushes towards the boundary where Oram gets a foot to it, accidentally, and the ball just to say stopped short of the rope
cut away off the back foot to the sweeper on the off-side boundary
defended off the back foot
opens the face of the bat and edges it wide of the slip
swept powerfully outside the off stump, through midwicket - what a shot. It's raced for four
a bit of indrift there and the right-hander nudges it to the leg side straight to a short fine-leg - they try to scamper a single before wisely deciding against it
clunked to long-on
well timed back to the bowler
very slow but perfectly directed, the batsman reads the speed of the ball very well and calmly comes forward to defend
big shout from McCullum who collects it on the leg side, but it's flicked his pad, not his bat. Good take, poor appeal
solidly defended
again he comes forward to defend
too short and pulled through midwicket
turned off his legs just wide of the fielder and they jog through for a well-placed single
oh, beautifully timed off the back foot into the covers - but there's a deep extra-cover on the boundary to save four
full, straight, fast and dug out by Jayawardene quite easily
a roar from Bond who fires this in short, but the pitch is just too slow...Jayawardene rocks back and pulls it with ease around the corner. No pace off this pitch now
calmly driven to mid-off
Tharanga stays back in his crease and uses the pace off the ball (what little there is) to time it through the covers to a deep extra cover. And there's his fifty - a fine knock
driven to cover
pushed back without any timing
he comes down the pitch, getting to the pitch and driving it through extra cover. Not hit with any great power - no need for Sri Lanka to do anything other than knock it around.
driven just wide of Patel who makes a fine diving save to his right
clunked to short midwicket
turned down to fine-leg and it nearly goes for four but Mills runs round to prevent the boundary
nice bit of away-drift for Patel before turning it back into the right-hander who reads the spin well, turning it fine for a single
good line outside the off stump and defended on the front foot
pushed off the back foot into the covers. No run.
neatly, expertly turned with a flick of his wrists by Jayawardene into the gap short of fine-leg
hammered in front of square but there's a sweeper out there
flicked off his pads, in the air this time but it's perfectly safe.
that's more like it as Jayawardene pulls this with great power over midwicket for four. Dreadful delivery from Patel, far too short
and that's a soft dismissal for Jayawardene who comes down the pitch and hits it straight down long-on's throat. Not literally of course - it landed in his hands. Fine innings from the captain
neatly turned off his legs for another single
quicker ball - flatter and straighter too - and there's a big roar for lbw, but the umpire shakes his bearded face

well bowled! Lovely bit of bowling giving it plenty of flight, dragging the batsman down the pitch, the ball spitting away from him and McCullum whips off the bails with ease. Super ball, that. Super innings too.
outside the off stump, quicker ball
ooh that's a cracker from Bond, swinging into the left-hander who plays-and-misses and it passes inches from his inside edge
defended off the back foot
defended off the back foot once more
great bouncer there from Bond, the batsman swaying out of the way at the last moment
turned off his legs for a single
flicked off his legs to the big man at mid-on who dives forward but can't quite grasp on. Fell short, actually
too short and pulled down to deep backward-square for a single
driven with a flourish off the back foot into the covers
can't quite get on top of this, defending it with his pad
lovely ball outside the off stump, the batsman comes forward and is comprehensively beaten
ooh Miss Moneypenny that was a good one, beating the batsman in the flight. Patel has been very impressive in this tournament and has done well again here today
edged to a short third-man
a touch shorter allowing the batsman to paddle it, aerially, to deep backward-square
comes forward to defend on the front foot
he skips down the pitch to upset Vettori's length, but defends it
lands this on middle - drifting it with a nice loop - but the batsman won't be tempted
defended once more
edged through and dropped. That one came in at the lefthander, pitched and straightened and took the outside lip of the bat
this time that one's played forward
swept confidently but finds the man
drops wide and that's moved out to square
walks forward into the drive and that's picked up at cover
cut off the back foot out to the man who's a fair way in from the boundary, sweeping
defended on the front foot this time
cut away off the back foot to the boundary where it's returned
pitches outside off and a big inside edge from a cover-drive cannons into the pads
defended this time on the front foot
dances right down the pitch but mistimes a whip off the legs which goes behind square and that's easily picked up
defended this time; that's well bowled
defended on the front foot
comes forward on the front foot and that's lovely use of his feet to pick up a couple on the leg side
pitches outside off and that comes back in at the batsman who defends it well off the back foot
slightly overpitched but it dropped on him very quickly and that's defended forward
shaped to cut but the ball turned back in pretty sharply at him and that's defended
bent in at the lefthander and that's defended again
defended this time
ooh, pitched outside off and the batsman tried to work that through square leg from outside off but was lucky to get away with it as he missed it totally
tickled to square
well waited for that one which is chopped down behind point
beautifully cut away for a single to point
down the track and that's beautifully placed by Sangakkara, lovely use of the feet; down to the pitch of the ball and that's lifted in the gap between mid-wicket and long-on
a well-struck cut off the front foot
overstepped and ruined what was otherwise a decent delivery on the button
nicely placed to point off the back foot
looks to work that one to third man but stops on the shot
comes forward looking to drive, but defends on the front foot instead
that one goes wide and it's firmly driven to the covers
square driven behind point for a gentle two
drops on a good length and that's tickled into the covers for a quick single
a bit of inswing and that's defended
defended off the back foot
tries to cut that one through point but picks the fielder
worked behind point
defended off the back foot this time
driven to the off-side boundary and that's a comprehensive victory for Sri Lanka
